FuncDef:
The atm interface-type command sets an ATM interface type.
The undo atm interface-type command restores the default ATM interface type.
By default, the type of an ATM interface is UNI.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the ATM interface type to UNI. If a device works on the user side, set the type of the ATM interface connecting to its peer device to UNI.
-

Sets the ATM interface type to NNI. If a device works on the network side, set the type of the ATM interface connecting to its peer device to NNI.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Interfaces on an ATM network are divided into the following types:
UNI: connects a data terminal equipment (DTE) to a data circuit-terminating equipment (DCE).NNI: connects DCEs.
A DTE accesses a network through a DCE.
Perform the following operations based on the ATM device location on the network.
If the device works on the user side, run the atm interface-type uni command to set the type of the ATM interface connecting to its peer device to UNI.If the device works on the network side, run the atm interface-type nni command to set the type of the ATM interface connecting to its peer device to NNI.

Configuration Impact
Running the atm interface-type command will change the VPI value range. For details, see the pvc command.
Precautions
The atm interface-type command can be run in the view of a serial interface only after the link layer protocol of the interface is configured as ATM.
